question.xref: DES s6, HC p113, KYTS p138
question.text: Why would this temporary speed limit sign be shown?

explanation.text: In the interests of road safety, temporary speed limits are imposed at all major road works. Signs like this, giving advanced warning of the speed limit, are normally placed about three quarters of a mile ahead of where the speed limit comes into force.

answer.text: To warn of the end of the motorway
To warn you of a low bridge
To warn you of a junction ahead
To warn of road works ahead
